intro: Erigeron altaicus, commonly known as the Alaskan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, rocky, or sandy habitats. The plant features a hairy stem and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Erigeron altaicus is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or tundra environments.
